item.title: Create an encrypted file container with dm-crypt
item.description: Create an empty file with the size of your container dd if=/dev/zero bs=1M count=100 of=~/my-container.img Here I’ll use a 100MB container Initialise the LUKS partition on the file and set the initial passphrase. cryptsetup luksFormat ~/mycontainer Open the container. Opening the container creates a kernel device file which can then be mounted. cryptsetup luksOpen ~/mycontainer secret-device This command will prompt for the container’s passphrase and then create a device file with the name /dev/mapper/secret-device.
